The fridge in the room is super cold, which is awesome. Some of the water placed up on the top shelf had some ice in it which was nice. It's a small, carpeted place (no shoes in the house! I liked that) and is for people on a tight budget. It will probably do you well to bring ear plugs, which I always do wherever I go. Note also there is another room that perhaps he is renting out,  so you may have some company besides Steve himself. I will definitely check his place out again in the future when I visit again!
Steve is one of the best host's I have met. He even helped me with my mom who can be a handful. Thanks again Steve!

Steve was very welcoming and hospitable. Very convienent location to downtown Waikiki. Steve offered $10 parking at the house which was super convienent and let us keep an extra car there our last night free of charge. The other guests staying at the house were also friendly and easy to talk to.

Flat is pretty good located, close to Waikiki and even in all directions direct to the highway.
The room is pretty the same as picture showes - small but absolutely sufficient. Flat was very clean. Unfortunately there was not that much consideration regarding loud music/TV very early or late...
Steve was a helpful host- very willing to accommodate and offer advise. Great deals on scooter rentals were an added bonus! The house was very clean as well which was lovely.
Place was cool n cozy....and Steve was a great host.... n I'll stay there again....anything I needed he helped out

Steve was a real legit dude, straight from the get go he made us feel welcome and comfortable after a 10 hour long flight from Australia. 
The room is pretty small, but hey, your in downtown Hawaii, what the hell are you doing hanging out in your room anyway.
It's a short walk to the postcard beach scenes that Honalulu is well known for. It's an even shorter walk though, to the Foodland at Ala Moana shopping centre. And trust me, if there is any place your gonna want to be, it's at the Foodland. I'm talking fresh Poke bowls, Chicken drumsticks, in house baked donuts, Sushi and there is even a bar there if your feeling a little thirsty from your travels.

If you want to see a little bit more than whats just around within walking distance. You can hire a moped or a scooter from Steve. And he can also give you some great local knowledge on where to go and what to check out.

I would definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone traveling to Hawaii.
Good place to sleep. Steve is a nice host. He also let me park my car in front for $10 which was really convenient.
Everything was fine. Just that the air conditioning didnt worked and the room was really hot.

Steve’s place was perfect for our trip. The location is great and the house had everything we needed. The room is small, but the beds are comfortable and the wifi is fast. We had a great stay. Mahalo!

This was exactly what I was looking for - somewhere to shower, and rest my head during a 12hr layover in Honolulu.
Steve was easy to get a hold of, and everything was ready when I arrived.
Great host, thanks Steve
Great place to stay! The house is really close to Waikiki beach and a lot of awesome restaurants. Steve is very responsive and helped us with whatever we need. Had a great time in Honolulu! Thanks!

Kleines Zimmer, fußläufig zum Waikiki Beach, gute Verkehrsanbindung, 
Unübersichtliche Wohnsituation speziellen Menschen
Steve was easy to communicate with, no nonsense (which I loved), and provided exactly what his ad claimed. Would stay here again in a heartbeat. Thanks Steve!
Steve war sehr freundlich und hat mir gute Tipps gegeben. Die Unterkunft war wie beschrieben.  Sehr gut war die zentrale Lage! Kann die Unterkunft empfehlen

Steve was very nice and helpful with finding places around the city. I was surprised I was paying for both of the bunk beds.. for some reason I thought it was just one... Had the room to myself. Warning he does have a lot of cats though so it does smell like cats... Good experience overall. Thanks Steve
A nice small room with good price. Free wi-fi and TV. Steve is a friendly landlord.
Ok deal for the money
The value is great and location is near all the shops and bars.

This is a great location and the host is very nice. However, may not be a good place to stay if you have a rental car, as there is no place to park. Ultimately I had to go elsewhere to a backup option due to this. (I rented a car.)
This place is a good choice for budget travelers.
很方便

Steve accommodated us on short notice for a night. 
The room is small but fine for two if they are friends or a couple.  Wifi is good and fast.  Nice air conditioning and a clean bathroom that's larger than we expected as well.  Mini-fridge is also a bonus!

Extremely convenient to Waikiki and Ala Moana mall and Hawaii Convention Center.  Lots of dining options around.  May not be appropriate for kids due to the nightclubs in the vicinity.  Note - Those with cat allergies should bring medication.  There are several cute ones around, although not necessarily inside.

Thank you, Steve!

Perfect central accommodation. You get exactly what you are promised. Steve is and super friendly host who helps you and answers your question with a smile to ensure your stay will be at your satisfaction.

Location is GREAT, 5 minutes away from Ala Moana Center, Don Quijote and next to the Convention Center. 
Room is small, but is great for the price. Nice TV with direct TV and mini fridge in the room. 

The room is a little hot during daytime and Window AC can't keep up, but it works great during PM hours.

Not recommended for people with cat allergies, although there are no animals inside, there are a handful of cats outside the property and the smell can come through the windows.

Perfect for budget travelers for bed and store luggage!!! 

There are other tenants living in the house and share the same bathroom, there was even someone sleeping in the living room, but it is separated by a room divider and did not bother me at all.
It's a room with a bed. Nothing special. Get what you pay for.

Perfect if you want to save money. The room is small, but it is cozy and has cable TV and air conditioner. The house is well located, next to Ala Moana beach and mall, and to the convention center. Also, it had easy access to bus leading to other relevant parts of the island. I did not meet Steve because he was travelling, but his friend Koosh (sorry I don't know if it is correctly spelled) was very friendly and helpful. It was a nice week :)

Great value! The location is perfect, walking distance to Waikiki and public transportation. If you have a fear of spiders, there were a handful of small spiders in the room/apt but they are harmless! The roommates are kind and provided good advice. I recommend this place for the location, quick communication, and value!

Great value! Excellently located right across from the Convention Center, groceries, convenience stores, a mall,  and close to Waikiki Beach. A little sketchy around the immediate neighborhood. Steve is very welcoming, and the place is small but well-kept. The AC was a welcome relief as well.
Worth to stay , really close to the downtown :)
Exactly as advertised. Simple. Laid back guy. Great location.

Das Zimmer was wir hatten war sauber und gut. Der Rest der Wohnung ist ziemlich unordentlich. Was cool war, wir konnten die Küche mitbenutzen. Wir hatten ein Mietauto, so war es kein Problem unsere Ziele zu erreichen. Preis leistungsverhältniss ist nicht so gegeben.

The loctation is awesome and really cheap price to stay here. Facilties are all okay. They were so nice to us. One problem we faced is that there was no reply from host, but if you just go to the address, they welcome you.
This is a great deal of you are tight on money and want to be in the city.  It is a 20 min drive from the airport and 10 min drive to the Waikiki Shell/beach. Comfy bed.  Clean bathroom.
Good budget place to stay. Get pretty much what's listed. House rules could be more clearly stated, other than that good.
Nice place to live!
Great for budget travelers. Centrally located.  The bus stops are nearby that will take you anywhere on the island.  Carpet is clean.  Good price for near waikiki lodging.
Steve was a generous host and very welcoming. the house was clean, safe and he provided the necessities. All around good guy. Thanks Steve

Great value if you want to be close to a lot of places to eat. Very quiet inside the home and the room feels like a little hotel room. The tenant was very welcoming as well. Books last minute too which is nice.

Steve was a great host, and had a prime location for exactly what's described - a shared home with a private room. I spent little time in the home and a lot of time exploring, since there was lots of stuff within walking distance.
Great place to crash for the night. Wouldn't want to stay more than that though. You should know that use of the microwave requires all air conditioning units to be turned off first.

Unfortunately my flight was delayed many hours bc of snow in Seattle and i didn't get to Steve's place until after midnight, & i had to leave just after 7am the next morning for a meeting, so i didn't get a chance to enjoy the place much.  But i was able to get in and get to bed quickly, and get ready in the morning.  Location is _very_ close to the convention center.  There was a fridge in the room,  a kitchen in the house, but i couldn't tell you too much more bc i was in and out, sorry i can't be much more help

It was ok. I was nervous upon arrival for a few reasons: lack of communication, and the surprise two other (male) residents. Steve answered my question when I booked, more than a month before the trip. However, when I tried to confirm a week before and ask about parking, I received no response. I decided to risk it and keep the booking because it was so conveniently located to my conference. I also received no response when I texted upon arrival at the airport. Check-in turned out to be fine, because the other residents were there, but it would have been nice, and normal, to have had communication with the host. The other residents were nice and helpful, but at first I was nervous about the surprise of staying with three men. It was pretty clean inside, even if the appearance outside would lead you to think otherwise. The room was fine with clean linens and towels, and the A/C was nice to have. There is a lock on the bedroom door, and there is a key so you can lock when you leave. I lost some sleep on the first night because there is a club just across the street, and a parking lot just outside the bedroom window. Bring ear plugs. 

Some other positives: very good price for Honolulu, 10-15 minute walk to the Ala Moana Beach Park (less crowded than Waikiki, which is a few miles away). Bus stops nearby. 5 minute walk to the Ala Moana hotel, where I picked up airport/tour shuttles. Residents were nice and helpful once there. 

But, communication! Airbnb-ers want communication!
Nice place, Steve is an excellent host

Great for the Value, Host is super helpful. Everything was as expected! Also great location for walking around the downtown.
I didn't mind as I grew up in the city but gets a little noisy at night. Did not bother me but I could see light sleepers having a problem.

This place is on the outskirts of town, really easy to get around. Had a few issues checking in trying to get keys etc. We left our stuff inside in the lounge room, We came back later to an empty house (didnt have keys) and couldnt get any of our stuff. We had booked a Luau for that evening and couldnt get in to change or shower. When we arrived later that evening one of the other guys living in the house let us in. The room is as pictured. Top bunk is a tad broken too. Its cheaper than everything else around but probably for a reason.

Das Zimmer war sauber und ordentlich. Die Betten waren sehr sehr unbequem. Es waren Matratzen mit Federkern und beim Schlafen hat man jede einzelne Feder gespürt.
 Das Bad ebenso, aber heruntergekommen. 
In der Wohnung und auch im Zimmer hat es etwas nach Rauch gerochen, das war etwas unangenehm. Im Rest der Wohnung war es etwas durcheinander und unordentlich, aber nicht dreckig oder eklig. 
Wir haben die Unterkunft nur gebucht, weil in der Beschreibung eine Waschmaschine im Gebäude angegeben war und wir auf unserer 9-wöchigen USA-Rundreise unsere Wäsche hin und wieder mal waschen müssen. Aber die Beschreibung der Ausstattung war nicht korrekt, es war keine Möglichkeit zum Waschen da, auch nicht gegen eine Gebühr. Wir haben unsere Wäsche in einem Laundromat waschen müssen....
Das Haus war in einer kleinen Seitenstraße mit einigen Obdachlosen und Nachtclubs. Sketchy neighborhood, würde man im amerikanischen sagen. Dafür war die Lage super zentral, ziemlich genau zwischen Downtown und Waikiki.
Geparkt haben wir an der Hauptstraße mit „metered parking“, in der kleinen Seitenstraße gab es nur begrenzt Parkmöglichkeiten, insgesamt ca 6 öffentliche Parkplätze.
Leider haben wir Steve persönlich nicht getroffen und von ihm keine Informationen oder Rückmeldung zum Check-In bekommen. Erst nach unserem Anruf kurz bevor wir ankamen. Yasuko, der Mitbewohner, war bei unserer Ankunft da und hat uns sehr freundlich empfangen und war sehr hilfsbereit. Er hat uns die Wohnung gezeigt und alles dafür getan, damit wir uns wohlfühlen können.  
Der Preis war für Honolulu während der Neujahrszeit im Vergleich zu anderen Unterkünften günstig, aber das Preisleistungsverhältnis hat unseres Erachtens nach trotzdem nicht gestimmt.
Clean room and bathroom.  The rest of the house has quite a bit of clutter.  Steve is very nice.  The location is a bit sketchy but also central; easy to get to Waikiki and Downtown.
Just for one night no more.
Exactly as advertised

Great for those who are looking for a no frills space to stay, and would be roaming around Honolulu most time of the day. It's at the center of everything - transpo, mall, Waikiki. It is near the redlight district that might not be okay for some, but personally I don't have issues with it. It might be a bit uneasy to roam at night, but you'd be fine with Steve.  Steve is a kind host. You'd like him :) It's $33 away from the airport. Aloha!

Room was as pictured and worked out as we only needed a place to sleep for a 1 night stay. Location was convenient. Less than a mile to the beach or to downtown Waikiki. 
Outside entry way smells of cat urine and many cats seen walking around parking lot. Lots of miscellaneous stuff inside and outside the house making it seem crowded. 

Overall, the stay was good for 1 night since we just needed the place to sleep and store our luggage.
Central location, can be noisy at times but that's about the only negative.  Inside is clean

Needed a place to stay in town that was affordable, and this place satisfied everything i needed: a place to sleep and shower.  Great place for a great price if you simply need a place to crash for a few nights

Read the reviews. They are pretty accurate. This is a home occupied by a great guy, Steve. The general living spaces are cluttered—clearly a man cave run amok. But, knowing that I would stay here again. Once I knew there were cameras surrounding the area (as it is a bit sketchy) I felt more comfortable walking around solo. But, I am Not a night owl and would never stay out late partying and walk back alone. The location otherwise is dynamite—walk everywhere-to beach, Ala Moana where you can catch a bus anywhere around the island. I walked to the Hawaii Art Museum three times- great exercise and a fun place to hang out, have a wonderful lunch, take tours to Shangri-La, etc. 
I never used the kitchen to cook. It was so easy to go to the food court at Ala Moana or ??? so many options. 
Steve's place is definitely nothing fancy—bunk beds (I rented the room for myself) but, there is a little refrigerator, TV, Wifi. Sheets and towels were clean. No shoes allowed in the house. 
Take advantage of this spot. It can't last forever as developers gobble up such prime locations!
Great location for the value
As described. Basic but it has all you need. Close to multiple bus stops and Biki stations (public bikes). However, do note that it's a noisy environment (nearby street and parking lot, a/c, etc.)
Place located amazing but bit struggled for check in. Thank you.
Gute Lage, perfekt für die erste Nacht zur Weiterreise

Steve was very welcoming and is located in a convenient spot, walking distance to many places we wanted to hit! Unfortunately we weren’t able to stay the entire weekend but Steve was very understanding and accommodating. Nothing fancy but definitely great location for the price.

This was an amazing value.  I selected it based on price, proximity to the conference center and safety.  All my expectations were met.  The location is less than half a block from the convention center.  I had reviewed previous guest comments and understand what to expect.  The location is on a street that still has original residences, with the surroundings having been taken over by services and buildings catering to a convention/tourist crowd.  The street is a bit run down....and on first glance sketchy.  BUT...the area was safe and within one block to bus directly into Waikiki.   The other direction, few blocks is high end shopping with bus to other venues including airport.  And location is three blocks from Don Quiote where one can buy food and anything else needed.  The room, bathroom and kitchen were very clean.  Other areas...clean but cluttered, but presenting no concern.   I am not a cat person and the cats were not expecting any petting or interaction so that worked out fine.   If one is a white glove, chocolates on the bed with turn down service kind of person, do not book.  But if one is enjoying of life and has basic needs....go for it. Host- Steve was gracious and considerate.   Would stay again.
Very down to earth and friendly host. Enjoyed my stay.
Nothing
It's dope
Great value and located in a great spot!
Steve was a sweetheart. It was much cleaner than I expected. He was sweet enough to let me check out at mid day as well. Would stay there again.
good place, quite close to visit all placess near to Waikkiky beach
very closely to ala-moana. thank you.

Communication with Steve was very good even if he wasn‘t at home. Room looks the same as on the photos but was very small and uncomfortable. A/C is very loud. Location is good for walking distances to shops and restaurants and beach, but very noisy at night.

The house is too messy on the outside. The TV was still on after 2:30am (too loud) and we were awakened at 2am by two people talking out loud. The room was very small for the price we paid (~80$). I would not recommend.
Steve is extremely hospitable and sets you up nicely with everything you could need for a short stay in Hawaii. The place is in walkig distance to the beach so it was perfect for my 24hr layover.

Steve's place was a great location for our short stay; close to the airport, right next to ala moana Shopping Centre and a short half hour walk to Waikiki!  we heard a little noise from neighbours at night but overall the room was a good, secure and clean place to spend the night with a very friendly and helpful host.  Thanks for having us!
great place to stay if you're lplanning on going out a lot and just need a place to crash in the evening. Steve can help you a lot with the local details if you have any questions. Aloha Steve
위치가 좋고 호스트가 친절합니다. 외부는 조금 지저분했는데 내부는 깔끔합니다.

Netter und hilfsbereiter Gastgeber mit einer preiswerten Unterkunft.
Leider Doppelbuchnung, wurde aber von Steve gelöst.

The house's located at an excellent place. A few minutes walk to the Ala Moana mall, department store and Walmart. Lots of restaurants around. It's a good place if you would like to stay in an excellent convenient place at a low cost. Mahalo!!
Great Location. Great place to stay.
I actually enjoyed my first experience in a hostel. The people who stayed there were cool. Steve is extremely nice and accommodating. I was able to check in earlier than expected.

Steve's place was killer. Highlights are host's communication and attentiveness to what you need. There was a good group of people and I think that attests to the relaxed vibe of the spot, everybody was friendly and chill. The spot was in a central location, I could take a road bike anywhere around Honolulu. Its a no frills location but the street is really calm, nothing to worry about. I liked it a lot and would return anytime.
Great location and nice host. Overall all positive!

I was traveling with my family of 4 and I just needed a place to stay for a few hours between my previous Airbnb check-out and my flight (which was very late at night). The entire place wasn’t anything like described. Steve gave me a “special offer” of 3 beds in a private room, that were not listed on Airbnb, which I paid more for. When I walked in, the kitchen had stains everywhere: on the fridge, counter tops, sink, and more. When I reached to turn on the light, I saw a huge ant colony. I get that Hawaii is hot and there could be insects. But ants don’t come out for nothing, they come out when there’s food laying around uncleaned. I was obviously frustrated and tried to call Steve to ask what I should do. But he never answered... I decided to walk in to take a look at the bedroom but my promised “private” room was not private at all. It was a shared room with multiple other guests. The entire room reeked of sweat and other odors. The entire place looked like it hadn’t been cleaned in years. I kindly asked for my money back but Steve told me to stop being childish and to stop texting him. I spent $50 on Uber to get there and $100 for the place. I am not an unreasonable person but this is so unfair. Nothing was as described so the decent thing Steve could do is to refund my money.
Convenient location and dorm style. A/C keeps the place livable and sleepable. If you’re on a budget, it’s not a bad place to be!
it's like a hostel
Great value for your money. Steve is very accommodating for his guests.
ｼｪｱﾊｳｽなので､ﾌﾟﾗｲﾍﾞｰﾄを完全に守りたい方にはお勧めできませんが､共に暮らすｹﾞｽﾄの方々がとても親切で愉快でとても楽しい時間を過ごすことができました!
Steve was a great host. I would recommend this place to my friends and would come back if I visit the area again.
If you need a bed. It’s perfect. Steve is extremely accommodating. The place is a bit noisy outside but other than it was great. Steve can’t control the noises outside, but he does his best.
Sometimes there is a wait fir the bathroom but still good!!
good

name: Country Oasis Retreat
summary: A perfect country getaway nestled in a gated country farm on the North Shore of Oahu. Large Kitchen, one bedroom, one Bath, walk in closet. Built in 2012 very clean and modern. Majestic mountain views overlooking old Hawaiian wetlands.
space: The property is quintessential North Shore country living, quiet sunsets and quiet mornings. Little to no street light pollution makes the night sky stand out. Trade winds cool the property and close proximity to the beach and Haleiwa town, make this an Ideal getaway with convince close at hand. The property has 7 mango trees, 6 large coconut palms, a large banana patch, small citrus orchard, small (but deep) tilapia pond and a small farm animal pen.
description: A perfect country getaway nestled in a gated country farm on the North Shore of Oahu. Large Kitchen, one bedroom, one Bath, walk in closet. Built in 2012 very clean and modern. Majestic mountain views overlooking old Hawaiian wetlands. The property is quintessential North Shore country living, quiet sunsets and quiet mornings. Little to no street light pollution makes the night sky stand out. Trade winds cool the property and close proximity to the beach and Haleiwa town, make this an Ideal getaway with convince close at hand. The property has 7 mango trees, 6 large coconut palms, a large banana patch, small citrus orchard, small (but deep) tilapia pond and a small farm animal pen. Guests will be given a gate code Guests sharing our property are welcome to solicit advise on outdoor activities and the local restaurant scene. Our two large friendly dogs love adults and will greet you when you arrive and depart, feel free to pet and play but please don't feed, they're a bit spoiled. Older
neighborhood_overview: Older small farm neighborhood: several small farms on the mountain side of the street with small planed family communities on the right of the street.
notes: Onsite laundry Gas Appliances Solar hot water WIFI and cable included (not responsible for connectivity issues) Just updated the Wifi network with an extender (due to guest reviews)...Now excellent signal in all rooms.
transit: Bus stop within walking distance, walking distance to Haleiwa (under 1 mile.) Quick access to local beaches
access: Guests will be given a gate code
interaction: Guests sharing our property are welcome to solicit advise on outdoor activities and the local restaurant scene. Our two large friendly dogs love adults and will greet you when you arrive and depart, feel free to pet and play but please don't feed, they're a bit spoiled.
house_rules: Respect everyone's personal space. Absolutely no parties, only people who are listed in the reservation are allowed on the property. No exceptions! Only one car is allowed per bedroom rented. No Smoking of any kind on any part of the property (inside included). No more than two guests per bedroom

host.host_about: Active in the local community, Quiet / Clean. Both very active in outdoor hawaii sports: Kite Surfing, Surfing, MTB riding, Spear Fishing & Hunting.

reviews.comments: What a wonderful place to stay! It was our first time using Air bnb and I have to say, Jeremy's place is exactly what we were looking for and more. He was very attentive and helpful with the surrounding areas and his dogs are really sweet and friendly. The places are clean, organized and modern with the Hawaii feel. The laundry room is a major bonus and the full kitchen was great to cook in. Lots of privacy, very peaceful and a beyond beautiful property with an AMAZING view. We will definitely be back. I highly recommend staying here, you can't go wrong. :)
The description was accurate & the property was wonderfully peaceful.

This is place is not what we were expecting, it's definitely beyond expectations!
Countryside, extremely peaceful, surrounded by nature and close from the beach and the towns of Hailewa and Waialua.
Unbeatable location and something that definitely stands for from most of the places listed on Airbnb is definitely Cleanliness, impeccable and super clean.
You will not find any other better listing on the north shore and Oahu in general and for such an unbeatable price.
Jeremy was beyond easy going. We decided to stay 5 more days and definitely recommending and staying here next time we're in Oahu.

Absolutely beautiful place to stay and very comfortable. Nice neighborhood. Incredible views. Great price, affordable, and all the comforts of home were included. The host was quick to respond to our needs and was very friendly and helpful. It was extremely clean and nicely decorated. Plenty of parking and property is gated. Conveniently located to the charming little town of Haleiwa. The owner's two dogs were friendly and adorable. If you are looking for peace and quiet and like listening to the sounds of nature, this is the place for you. We will definitely stay here again on our next Hawaiian vacation. I would highly recommend staying here.
Relaxing and refreshing.

There space was great, and location was perfect. We loved having a kitchen for some healthy meals in, and took advantage of the ripe fruit on the property.  Jeremy responded immediately to all requests and messages.  We had a lovely time!

Our stay was very pleasant. The unit was nice- furnished nicely with lovely views of the mountains beyond some fields. The location necessitates renting a car, but with a car it is a convenient and short drive to Haleiwa. What was surprising was that this unit was in the middle of two other units, like an apartment complex, and on the bottom floor of the main house. It was quiet- we could not hear other renters on either side of us, but would occasionally see them pass by en route to their unit (or we passed by on our way to ours). We could occasionally hear those upstairs walking.
The stay was great! The location was perfect to visit the north shore beaches.

Big place with private bathroom and dinning room with kitchen appliances. The front porch you have a view of nature and fresh air to breath. Everything is great here. Clean bed, clean room and clean toilet. Only 5 minutes drive to Haleiwa town and less than 10 minutes drive to Haleiwa pier and the beach. Mini mart and bakery is by the corner, very convenience.

The place is clean and spacious. Our host welcomed us when we arrived. He was gracious to offer us the mangoes from his garden.

The kitchen is well equipped. So we were able to cook our own meals. Another good thing is the washer and dryer. Washing liquid was provided which was really great. We were able to do our laundry something that you do not always get from AirBnB apartments in Hawaii.

The location is rural and hence you need to drive about 35 min to town. But really close to North Shore Beaches so it is a boon if you like the country. We like the environment and we have spotted two rainbows in the mornings.

The animals were so cute, they smile and look at you.  I was expecting barking because most dogs bark when strangers approach but nope, they just look at you and chill.  The place is definitely secluded.  The beautiful view of the greenery and sky was welcoming. 

Jeremy's amazing!  He was always quick to answer ANYTHING and EVERYTHING I had questions or concerns about.  He went out of his way to walk to our door and hand us fresh picked coconuts!  My fiance and I agree we're DEFINITELY staying here again but hopefully, the get-away instead =) 

Car is a must unless one is willing to do Lyft or Uber around town. Our battery needed a jump start and he was able to do it. We were so grateful.  

Our space was beautiful, high vaulted ceilings, recessed lights, smooth floor plating... if I had more money, I would've stayed longer. Kitchen had coffee, yay! and pots, pans, utensils for cooking, cooking oil, salt and pepper.  Bathroom had fresh clean towels, shampoo was provided, just be sure to bring your own hair dryer.

I loved the privacy sliding door for bathroom as well as the end of the main hallway separating the bedroom and kitchen. 

I wish I didn't fell sick, I was battling a sore tummy and caffeine withdrawals and kept tossing and turning.  However, with the fast internet, I did get my work done, which was a top priority. Our unit was in the center, so we always had to pass one unit and I try not to make any eye contact so I can give the tenants privacy.
Great place, good value.

Great place to stay on the North Shore! Description is very accurate and the large space was fantastic. Quite a few ants but we sprayed Home Defense and that helped. No AC was a little difficult to deal with but made us feel like a local and it stayed cool at night. Beautiful view and wonderful walking distance to a bunch of great places to eat and the beach.

The location is perfect for north shore activities...minutes from Haleiwa for shops and restaurants and beaches. The property itself is next to an area that's populated by many birds of all types. It was great to sit there in the morning and evening listening to birdsong and watching them do their thing. The dogs on the property are very well behaved and friendly.

Everything I could ask for in an Airbnb: host is super responsive, gives you all the information you need, easy check-in/out, location is fantastic, space was exactly as pictured,  very clean and well equipped. Hope it's available next time I'm on the North Shore. 

The North Shore is a very special place and staying here is a great way to experience it.

Host was very responsive to our needs, everything was as it was described. Great location, quiet and serene. Love the dogs, very friendly and made us feel like home. Definitely would stay there again.

The unit was everything as indicated in the photos and description but with one major omission - this is one of three units next to each other. The unit we rented, the "Retreat", was in the middle of the other two units, on the ground floor of the main house. Now, if you place privacy at a premium this is definitely not recommended as a place to stay. The major issue we had is that the other guests (if there were any) would be forced to walk right past you, onto your Lanai (porch) as there is no other path and look right into the unit with its large windows. There is a screen on the lanai (sort of) being shared by the three units but it is not private at all. The curtains also don’t close completely. When we asked the host if it would be possible to move to the unit at the end, because this was definitely not as advertised, his first response was that this would not be possible as other people would be arriving the following day. He then said we could, but at an additional cleaning fee. He also said we were renting the cheapest unit. We went onto the Airbnb site and found the other units, which are both advertised completely separately, but with the same description under different names and they were exactly the same price. In addition, he also replied that "they try to make it apparent on their Airbnb page that there are three units adjacent to each other” - but good luck in finding this description anywhere. 
 
On the positive side, the rooms were large and clean and we were woken up by birdsong in the mornings.

We really enjoyed our stay here. The location was great, away from touristy areas, nice and secluded, you feel like you are somewhere in the middle of the country side. If you want to stay here you definitely need a car to get around. It does get quite hot in the evenings but they have fans to keep you cool. The host is welcoming will help you with any recommendations, the dogs are very friendly too. Couldn't have asked for a better place!

My fiancé and I had a wonderful experience here. We were able to enjoy a peaceful getaway and enjoy the very green scenery of the island. There is plenty of privacy, the host was very responsive and constantly checking on us to be sure we were having a great stay. We had a fridge, stove and oven in our room and access to the washer and dryer. Dogs were super friendly, gated parking. We would definitely stay again.
Very nice place great all around i would diffently stay there again thanks North Shore

We had a great 9 day stay at the country oasis retreat. Our host, Jeremy was very warm and welcoming. He greeted us upon arrival and was always responsive when needed. He gave us a lot of information on things to do in the area. Most of our communication was via email, which was fine for us. He also checked in with us to make sure we had everything we needed. 
The unit was clean, nicely put together and very spacious. Good quality appliances, Full kitchen w/microwave and fridge. Pots, pans, cooking utensils, etc. Enough room for two people and possibly a third.  It was nice and a major plus having washer/dryer access a few step outside of the unit.  Bath and beach towels as well as shampoo and bath wash was there for our use.
The bed was firm. Im not sure it was a queen. Maybe a little smaller but we both slept comfortably every night. A couch and flat screen tv w/hdmi hook up in the bedroom. No A/C but we were very comfortable using the ceiling fans and plug in fan w/window open.  The wifi worked fine. This is also a gated property so we felt safe at night. 
Our unit was in the middle of two others. Great view of the mountains. To enter and leave the units you will need to cross through the neighbors lanai.  We were aware of this in advance and wasn't bothered since we were out most of the day. Just something to consider if you are looking to sit outside in privacy. Loved being greeted by the dogs. They were very well behaved and sweet as pie.  The toads come out at night. I was tickled seeing them hoping around the property when we came back from our adventures. I enjoyed hearing roosters some mornings in the far distance or the beautiful birds singing.  A couple of little lizards here and there but it's to be expected. 
This is a great side of town to visit. Plenty of things to keep you busy during the day and then having a quiet place to come back and rest. It's a good idea to rent a car. We drove all up and down the coast. It is very amazing and the views are simply breathtaking! Make sure to try the cooked snacks at the corner store and try the sno puffs at the bakery up the street. 
You will not be disappointed staying here. We would definitely come back again. :-)
This place was a fantastic getaway on the north shore. The host was very attentive, the view from the porch was exotic, the dogs are very sweet. We really enjoyed our stay here!

Beautiful property in the countryside near Haleiwa. Absolutely blissful, quiet spot. There are neighboring AirBnB guests on either side of you, but we barely saw them while we were at the unit. The host was kind and communicative, but was mostly invisible and out of the way. The bed was comfortable and the unit itself was well-built from high-quality materials. It's a nice place to stay!

The internet is fast – sometimes. I was trying to participate in a work video conference while there (I know, it was a bad way to spend time on Oahu), and the connection sporadically bounced between super fast and almost nonexistent. It could be the local service provider, it could be the distance that the network repeater is from the main unit, or it could be heavy use by others on the network, but it was a problem since the unit is also in an area with poor AT&T coverage so I couldn't use my phone to connect, either.

Regardless, if you're staying here for a few nights, I hope you don't have to spend much time on the computer. There's too much nearby to enjoy!

My dad & I stayed there for a month. We were very welcome by the dogs who are so nice. The place is very cute and calm. The town of Haleiwa is very close 2min driving and the north shore surf spot like pipeline Waimea or sunset aren't that far neither 15 to 20min driving. The place was perfect for what we where looking for. Simple and useful, calm and well situated. Very recommended

Excellent place if you're looking for some peace and quiet. Short 5 min drive to Haleiwa. Great location if you're looking to surf on the north shore. Great restaurants nearby. Would recommend a car for sure though if you really want to get out and check some nearby beaches and hikes. Excellent stay. Full kitchen is always plus.

Great place but do not try to shower during prime time and the sliding doors didn't close. Overall, this was an amazing place and the sunrises were breathtaking. The dogs on the property were really friendly as was the host. I rate this place 8 out of 8 mate, it was great.

Jeremy is absolutely phenomenal. He makes it very easy to check in, and is always there if you need ANYTHING. The space is three individual units at the back of his beautiful house and you have an amazing view. The walls are a little thin (you can hear the TV in the next unit) but everybody I met there was so nice and courteous. The view from your unit will be breathtaking and the accommodations were perfect.
Awesome place!

Everything about the location is perfect for visitors to the North Shore. Easy parking, convenience store nearby (and an ice cream shop and bakery!) and so close to Haleiwa and easy access to everything. Clean and comfy. Gorgeous views. Quiet and relaxing
The unit was great! This is the second time that we've stayed with Jeremy and Jessica, and we would not hesitate to do so again!

This is such a special place! Very clean, comfortable, peaceful, scenic and secure.  We loved the king sized memory foam mattress - we slept like babies - and ample storage provided by the walk-in closet. Next time, we'll stay longer and take advantage of having a full kitchen and deck. We are so very happy with our stay there - just wish it could have been longer. Thank you so much!!

This was our first time staying in an Airbnb. We really enjoyed our stay here! The owners are friendly, the dogs are nice, and the property is beautiful. Great location close to Haleiwa and the North Shore. Just some things to be aware of, the bed is very firm, but probably not too bad if you're used to a firm bed. Also because there are dogs on the property, just be aware of where you step. This did not bother us at all, as we have dogs at home too, just something to pay attention to. We loved having a full kitchen which allowed us to buy some groceries and cook a few meals. Overall, we thought it was great! A fantastic value for the price, and we would definitely stay here again.

This spot is great. It's extremely quiet, very private and the space itself seems new. The location is pretty central for the North shore since you can drive further up to all the surf and beach spots but it's only about 30 minutes to Honolulu. The hosts are making a lot of effort as well. I would definitely stay again.

Jeremy and Jessica are great hosts. They were helpful and friendly. The property is nice and quiet, and we felt very secure there. The dogs were nice and were not a problem at all. The unit was exactly as described and had everything we needed. We would definitely stay here again.
Great spot, stayed twice.

The unit was lovely and exactly what we were looking for. It was clean, spacious and having the kitchen area was nice. We were very comfortable and felt very safe. It was quiet but we could drive to shops/restaurants quickly and without hassle. Next time we're back in the North Shore, we would definitely stay here again.

Jeremy and Jessica were great host. The place was great and we had everything we needed. We were very close to the beach and a shopping center which was very convenient. They have two sweet dogs that come say hi! Would recommend!

Quaint place within walking distance of Haleiwa. Great owners, pleasant and attentive.
 We'd stay here again.
Great place to stay, very comfortable and quiet. Their dog adira is the sweetest

Very accurate and awesome place! This is a one bed/one bath apartment you are renting built on the first floor of the host's beautiful two story home. Our space was the middle space in between two other rooms. Very clean, fully furnished with everything you could need from towels to dishes to pots and pans and laundry just outside the room. For the price and location, you can't beat this place!

This cozy villa is a beautiful modern yet country living home. I can guarantee that the view from the backyard is breathtaking! I facetimed my parents so they could see our view LOL. Adira their dog was so sweet!! At first my boyfriend was a little scared since there was no AC but jeremy informed us about the breeze at night and he accomodated us with fans and it was just perfect! I loved my stay here :D
The house is not far from Haleiwa but it's still a bit far from downtown.  The bed was very hard and uncomfortable and my back hurt after first night.   The place was clean and quiet.
This was a magical and special place to stay. Exactly what we where looking for. Quiet and beautiful location. The host was very welcoming and easy to get in though with. We will stay here again.

Awesome, secluded place. There's a fence to keep the car inside the property. Two sweet dogs. And beautiful views of the mountains and sunset. Super close to restaurants and shops. Very relaxing place to stay.
North Shore Country Living was our first air bnb experience and it was perfect. Definitely reccomend North Shore Country Living if you are looking to stay up at the North Shore for a couple days.

大豪邸で驚きました｡
指示が的確だったので､ﾁｪｯｸｲﾝはとてもｽﾑｰｽﾞです｡
ｷｯﾁﾝ､ﾀﾞｲﾆﾝｸﾞ､ﾍﾞｯﾄﾞﾙｰﾑ､ｼｬﾜｰﾙｰﾑ､ｳｫｰｸｲﾝｸﾛｰｾﾞｯﾄと機能が全て揃っているので､住んでる感覚を味わえます｡
ｻﾝｾｯﾄの時間帯の景色は最高です｡
この家のおかげでゆったりとﾉｰｽｼｮｱを体感できました｡
ｵｰﾅｰはﾒｰﾙをするとすぐ返事をしてくれ､私達は滞在中わがままを言い､洗濯用の洗剤を分けて頂きました｡
よくしつけされた犬が2匹いて､夕飯時に家の扉の前に毎度やってきて､とてもかわいいです｡

This place is amazing. The view is beautiful. The owners are amazing and attentive. Place is clean and cared for. If you love the North Shore this is the place to stay. Was very quiet and peaceful. Stayed here for two months and loved every minute.
Great place for anyone visiting the North Shore! Clean and cozy.
Best place so far to stay on the north shore!!! Jeremy and his wife are so friendly and their place is awesome. Nice, clean and quiet all you need for a nice trip! And perfectly equipped
Had a great time here. Very good location, private and quiet. As most places on Oahu, it's best to rent a car. Awesome bakery right around the corner. Also close to Haleiwa town and surf.

ﾊﾚｲﾜﾀｳﾝの近くの住宅地で静かな環境です｡
お部屋も綺麗でした｡
ﾗﾝﾄﾞﾘｰがあるので洗濯と乾燥ができたのも良かった｡(洗剤はないので持参した方が良いです)
とても良い滞在になりました｡
ﾉｰｽに滞在する際にはまた利用したいです｡

THE best! Such a beautiful place! There is nothing better than feeling at home while on vacation! Amazing space with the best views! Would stay here over and over again if we could! Short drives to downtown Haleiwa and easy routes to downtown Honolulu or anywhere on the island really! Can’t wait to come back and stay here again!
Great location. Amazing back yard view. Dogs make you feel at home the second you walk in. Great host. Always checks up on us.  If I ever come back, I would definitely stay here again.
north shore living is quiet, peaceful, and natural setting;  I hope to return again
Great value. Very clean and easy  access. Private parking on site. Full kitchen in a spacious suite. Other guests and Host home is above you, so some minor noise. Good WiFi. Jeremy is a great host.
Nice place and good experience. Enjoyed being in the country and the suite was comfortable.  Only downside was wifi that didn’t work.
Have fun and enjoy the laid back environment. Sunsets are amazing. The host is friendly and the dogs are so lovable. Have a relaxing time. Aloha!
Beautiful place to stay.
Nice, big, quiet, relaxed space. Bugs were getting in but weren't too much of an issue. Definitely worth the price. Sheets needed to be cleaned though.

The location was great for exploring and enjoying the North Shore.  It was nice to have a secure, quiet, and private place to return to after the day out at the beach etc.  The queen bed however was terrible, very hard and the mattress was sitting on top of two twin boxsprings which stuck out the sides of the bed making it awkward.  The bed alone would keep us from recommending this place, or staying there again in the future, which is unfortunate because everything else was fine and Jeremy was very responsive to our texts or calls which we appreciated.

Great location to explore the North Shore! The space itself is huge and comfortable. Be sure to rent a car as it is definitely a rural location but you can't beat the view - the stars at night are amazing.

A quiet, beautiful location. Keep in mind that is is not a walkable distance to anything. Haleiwa is close, but definitely driving distance.
We ended up checking out and going to stay at the Turtle Bay resort - it was significantly more expensive, but cleaner, with more amenities close by, and a much more comfortable bed.

This was our favorite (Website hidden by Airbnb) was a little oasis. We felt like it was our home away from home and appreciated host's prompt communication with us and access to a washer and dryer was amazing. Would highly recommend this spot for anyone looking for a comfortable welcoming oasis in the north shore.

This is definitely Hawaiian country living. The scenery at this property is breathtaking! It’s a close drive to shops, food trucks, and the beach. This property is definitely for people who want seclusion and peace.

Awesome place to stay in the North Shore! Super close to town with nice shopping and good food. Also beautiful not crowded beaches near by. Full kitchen with all the cooking tools. Big comfy bed. Amazing views of mountains and quiet. If I ever come back I will definitely stay here again. Thanks for having us!

NO AIR CONDITIONING!  This place definitely has potential but that detail ruined our stay as a result.  We were attending a wedding so it makes it tough to get ready and out the door for an event without being in a full sweat.  If you are there during the hours of 9:00 AM - 9:00 PM you will be hot even with the windows open.  It was really a shame if that one detail were changed then the entire experience would have been different.  The space looked like it had been recently updated and the studio feel was nice.

PROS
-Newly renovated space
-Full Kitchen/ Dining Room
-Couch + Cable TV
-Decently clean
-Quiet
-Countryside view
-Dogs were very nice and did not bark or bother us (I will say you may need to watch your step in the grass area near the sidewalks)

CONS
-NO AIR CONDITIONING
-Shower door (Hit my head on this thing in and out about 7 or 8 times....Not sure who builds a shower door that doesn't allow anyone over 5'6" to enter the shower without hitting their head....)
-Lighting was very limited if you are checking in at night.  Very hard to find the front gate and the actual unit once on the property as there are very few lights outdoors so we were in the pitch black.
-Due to the property location being next to an open countryside view it lends itself to a lot of bugs mostly outside of the unit (This didn't bother me too much since they are a part of life but when you walk in and out this was a bit of a distraction)

Love the place. Cute. Quiet. Perfect place if you are always on the move and just need a place to sleep. We were always hiking between 5 and 7am and back home by 7-8pm. So the hottest times of the day we we’re away.

We simply loved this place. The stay had more than enough place for two people, was clean and very well equipped. Check-In was easy and the communication fast. You‘ll have your own privacy with a beautiful view from the terrace. 2min by car to charming Haleiwa. Thank you for the hospitality! (Btw: the dogs were so cute and friendly!)

This place was great! There’s a nice coffee place right down the road within walking distance. To get to town is almost 2miles, so if you don’t mind walking that far, you’re right down the road from all of the awesome stores and markets ☺️
The condo was super clean and the bed was comfy as well! They have all of the amenities that you could possibly want! I only have great things to say about this place! The property itself is so beautiful and they have an amazing view of the mountains in the back yard. The property was very clean and made you feel right at home. I’d highly recommend staying here as it’s well worth what you’re paying for! ☺️

Another great experience. Quick responses, awesome bed, incredible breeze (enhanced with the amazing fans as well). Overall, it's always a pleasure to stay here. Far enough away from the hustle and bustle, but close enough to restaurants, beaches, and mountains to make it the perfect location.
Over all very nice place with everything you need to stay on island. Convenient to north shore which is a personal favorite. Quit and relaxing atmosphere. Only discomfort is there is no AC.
Has such a beautiful view out the back. Great poke, coffee, ice cream and vegetarian place close too. Thanks so much!

Quiet. Clean. Conveniently located. Secure/safe parking. 

Cons: no a/c
Good location, friendly hosts.
Awesome place to stay very clean close to everything And very secure
Best place to stay on the north shore

We had some issues at the beginning with dirty sheets which the owner quickly resolved. Brought new sheets and send the cleaner the next morning. 

Unfortunately, the dust we mentioned about the tv stand was still there afterwards. The lanai isn’t the cleanest either and there is dog poop on the lawn, which gets picked up after a view days. Nothing major but not sparking clean. 

All in all, we had a nice time here and would recommend it after a good clean. Great sunsets.
The place was easy to find and had enough supplies in the kitchen to make a few small meals. I would stay here again.

Great last minute booking...cute, clean and convenient, close to the Haleiwa round about so great central NS location. It is more of a compound, so many rentals in one main building but private enough for what we needed, probably not for honeymooners :) Overall, great stay!

My partner and I really loved this place! 
It was a romantic getaway away from the hussle and bussle but a close 3 minute drive into Haleiwa town. We really liked the high ceilings with the fans and the very comfy bed (I am now missing it) 
The coffee machine didn't work but we didn't bother the hosts we made it work. 
Everything was super clean with extra goodies to enjoy the stay. This place was very clean and we didn't see many bugs only cute frogs outside. Also having a laundry machine was a huge plus.
We met Jeremy on our last day when we were checking out he seemed very nice and has a lovely home with amazing views. 
We would defiantly recommend this place and stay here again!
This is a nice and quiet place.  A nice view on the back. Very clean and a real comfy bed. We were in Country Living Retreat.
Loved our stay! Highly recommend.
Great Location! Good Value! will try to stay here again in the future.
Great stay. Thanks
Wir hatten eine schöne Zeit auf der Insel und die Lage der Unterkunft ist perfekt , um von dort aus schöne Ausflüge zu starten.

name: Clean, comfortable and convenient
summary: Great apartment centrally located within 5 mins walking distance to Causeway Bay and Tin Hau MTR's.  Times Square, SOGO Dept store and various other shops within walking distance. Lots of restaurants to choose from in the area.
space: Our apartment offers 2 large bedrooms both with queen size beds. A sofa bed is also available that can sleep 2 guests. Fresh linen and towels will be provided during your stay. Cozy living area with 45" TV and Apple Tv. Wifi access available. Separate dining area with table and chairs. Kitchen provides fridge, 2 gas stove tops, oven, toaster, and Nutri Bullet. Although no  hot water in Kitchen, there is a kettle for boiling water to clean dishes. There is also a hot and cold Bonaqua water cooler avail in the flat. Shower and bath tub available in the bathroom with hot water. Washing machine is also provided in the flat.
description: Great apartment centrally located within 5 mins walking distance to Causeway Bay and Tin Hau MTR's.  Times Square, SOGO Dept store and various other shops within walking distance. Lots of restaurants to choose from in the area. Our apartment offers 2 large bedrooms both with queen size beds. A sofa bed is also available that can sleep 2 guests. Fresh linen and towels will be provided during your stay. Cozy living area with 45" TV and Apple Tv. Wifi access available. Separate dining area with table and chairs. Kitchen provides fridge, 2 gas stove tops, oven, toaster, and Nutri Bullet. Although no  hot water in Kitchen, there is a kettle for boiling water to clean dishes. There is also a hot and cold Bonaqua water cooler avail in the flat. Shower and bath tub available in the bathroom with hot water. Washing machine is also provided in the flat. Guests can easily access the apartment by Bus, Taxi, MTR or Tram. There is an elevator in the building. Although will not be in Hong Kong at the
neighborhood_overview: Our flat is located in a convenient part of Causeway Bay. Easily accessible by all modes of transport. Hong Kong Central Library is just across the road where there are many bus stops that can take you all over Hong Kong. The flat is within 5 mins walking distance from Causeway Bay Exit E MTR and Tin Hau Exit B MTR. Guests coming from Airport can take either A11 or E11 bus getting off at Victoria Park. Victoria Park is a great place for guests coming with children as there are lots of playgrounds within the park.  Many shops and restuarants within walking distance including Times Square, Hysan Place and SOGO department store. There is a 24hr Wellcome supermarket located 5 mins walk from the flat as well as a 24hr 7/11 located downstairs. Starbucks and McDonalds are also just around the corner.  Wanchai, famous for its bars and nightlife is a short bus/taxi drive away. Lan Kwai Fong and Soho, also famous for great restaurants and nightlife is also a short taxi ride or easily accessible
notes: Tea and Coffee will be provided.  There is a small room with a dehumidifier used for drying clothes after washing. Alternatively there is a laundromat located in the street. Garbage can be taken to the large garbage bin in the stairwell.
transit: Getting around Hong Kong from our flat is very convenient. As mentioned above, lots of bus routes passing by and close to the MTR. Please feel free to ask about a specific route.
access: Guests can easily access the apartment by Bus, Taxi, MTR or Tram. There is an elevator in the building.
interaction: Although will not be in Hong Kong at the time of your stay, I will be available via email or (Hidden by Airbnb) for any queries/questions you have during your stay. Key will be given to you on arrival by my sister and then collected at the end of your stay.
house_rules: Please be clean and respectful and treat home as if it were your own. No parties or events. No smoking inside the house Please remember to turn off air conditioners when not in use.

host.host_about: I am a 33 year old Australian expat living with another 31 year old female. Have lived in Hong Kong for 13 years. As we are both teachers, we usually travel during the school holidays therefore will be renting our flat during these times.

address.street: Hong Kong , Causeway Bay, Hong Kong

reviews.comments: Dominique's flat was fantastic. The welcome book was full of wonderful information on Causeway Bay as well as everything Hong Kong had to offer. The flat was much bigger than we had anticipated and had all the amenities required for a medium term stay.  Although we didn't actually get to meet Dominique, she answered all our queries and was very helpful. I would highly recommend Dominique's place for anyone looking for a place in Hong Kong.

The apartment was at a very convenient location. It was a very safe neighbourhood and we had many choices of food/cafes around Causeway Bay area. Transportation like tram/bus/MTR a stone's throw away. 

Thank you Dominique, it had been a pleasant stay!

The place is accessible to all public transportation. It is spacious and good enough for big family to stay. The host was accommodating and we didn't have a hard time looking for the place and communicating with them. I would definitely recommend this place for an enjoyable and stress-free trip in Hong Kong!

Dominique's place is very clean and spacious. It's got everything you need. She was very helpful and thoughtful. I was travelling with two elders and one child and the location made it easy for us to move around.

name: Comfy Studio with private entrance,  awesome views
summary: The studio ohana is located at 4000 ft and has awesome sunsets and views of the southern most tip of the US on a clear day. The studio is furnished with a queen size bed, linens, fridge, 2 gas burners, fully equipped kitchen, hot water, shower & flush toilet. We stock the frig with eggs picked from our chickens, bagels or bread, cream cheese, cream & butter. Local grown coffee, and tea. A cooler with blue ice is available for guests to use while enjoying  our beautiful island attractions.
space: The studio ohana is located on a one acre Ohia lot  On a clear day guests can view the southern most tip of the US, Southpoint. Cool evenings and nights!
description: The studio ohana is located at 4000 ft and has awesome sunsets and views of the southern most tip of the US on a clear day. The studio is furnished with a queen size bed, linens, fridge, 2 gas burners, fully equipped kitchen, hot water, shower & flush toilet. We stock the frig with eggs picked from our chickens, bagels or bread, cream cheese, cream & butter. Local grown coffee, and tea. A cooler with blue ice is available for guests to use while enjoying  our beautiful island attractions. The studio ohana is located on a one acre Ohia lot  On a clear day guests can view the southern most tip of the US, Southpoint. Cool evenings and nights! Guests have their own entrance, space, outdoor seating areas and on site parking.   Experience nature with the garden hot shower with privacy enclosure adjacent to the ohana entrance and in your own private garden setting. The ohana is powered with solar, batteries providing 110 power, and back-up generator. The Ohana is located in the lower level wi
neighborhood_overview: Very peaceful! Beautiful night skies. Because of our elevation cool evenings.  Tip: Bring warm clothes! There are activities in our immediate area from hiking trails, cavern tour's, green sands, farmers markets, swap meets and more. Kau is famous for it's coffee. We promote local businesses and stock the ohana studio with fresh roasted coffee beans. Just minutes away in the Town Center are 6 restaurants, 3 gas stations, 2 grocery stores,  one convenience store (Kahuka County Market - also selling gas), Ace Hardware, A nice Gift Shop (by Spirit Gas), Barber/Stylist Salon, a Business Support Center, US Post Office and a Auto Parts Store, a vet office, a great chiropractor and more!
notes: OCEAN VIEW is one of the largest sub divisions, with 11,000 one acre parcels. The sub division also known as HOVE has privately owned paved roads. There are 6 Eateries within 25 minutes of the Ohana.  The studio ohana is in the lower level. Cool nights and beautiful skies!  TIP:  Bring a warm sweater, jacket, etc.
transit: The studio is located up slope approximately 8 street crossings off the main entrance road to the sub division, Aloha Boulevard. All the streets in the sub division are privately maintained and are all paved. The town of Ocean View has two grocery stores (open until 8 pm), 3 gas stations (close by 8-8:30 pm), a laundromat (closed in Wednesdays), a coffee/sandwich shop (open for breakfast and lunch),  3 restaurants,  2 pizzeria's, Ace hardware, a business center, a thrift store, post office,  chiropractor  and several other businesses. On Saturday (7 a.m. to 1 p.m.) there is a  swap meet with food vendors,  local produce, and crafts.   The Ohana is approximately 60 miles from the Kona airport in the village of Ocean View, also known as HOVE.   Hilo is approximately the same distance. Guests need to have some type of rental vehicle; car, truck, motorcycle, etc.  to get to and from the Ohana and to explore our beautiful island.
access: Guests have their own entrance, space, outdoor seating areas and on site parking.   Experience nature with the garden hot shower with privacy enclosure adjacent to the ohana entrance and in your own private garden setting. The ohana is powered with solar, batteries providing 110 power, and back-up generator.
interaction: The Ohana is located in the lower level with it's own entrance, kitchen with a 2 burner cook stove, refrigerator/freezer, flush toilet, shower and garden seating area.  Experience nature with the garden hot shower with privacy enclosure adjacent to the ohana entrance. The host lives in the main cabin on property. Texting is the best. Feel free to contact me if you have any questions.
house_rules: - Smoking in outside designated area. - Quiet after 10 pm. - No shoes\slippers in house.

host.host_about:
Born and raised on a 5 generation dairy farm in Minnesota.

Been on the Big Island for over 20 years.

Built most all of our cabin in the clouds ourselves. Am totally off-grid with wind and solar stocking our battery bank with power.

reviews.comments: Carol Ann's place is amazing! We flew into Kona and stayed for a night so we could go to the South Point Cliff Dive, black sands beach, and the lava flow at Kalapana - all a reasonable drive away. The studio has gorgeous views of the ocean and surrounding volcanic terrain, and Carol Ann and her partner were so welcoming and helpful re: plans for our adventures. In the morning we enjoyed eggs (from Carol Ann's chickens) and fresh ground coffee (that she provided) at a table outside with a view of the Pacific and lamented not being able to stay longer.

Good place. Really nice people. Be aware the toilet and shower are not connected and the shower is outdoors. Aside from that the views were amazing and having a full kitchen was a life saver on the big island. The drive is somewhat Long but beautiful.

It was a must go/seen/stay place. Lovely and beautiful private room. Fully equipped (refrigerator, stove, dishesh, wine glasses, mugs, rice, pasta, cream, fresh eggs,... everthing).
Nicely decorated. Clean and quiet. It was a fully functional studio in excellent shape. 

The view was stunning. You could have your meal on top of the lava and enjoy the ocean view. The garden was super nice. 

Our host was frindly gentleman who we enjoyed talking to him. We highly loved our stay over there and will do it again for sure.

We really enjoyed our time at Carol Ann and Michael's place. Michael gave us great and thoughtful tips on local beaches and trails and we had a really comfortable stay. It was perfect for our needs and was in a really unique place amongst the lava flows and Ohia trees.

The ohana is really nice and the kitchen is well equipped. We had fresh coffee, fresh eggs, toast, cheese and even delicious banana bread. Michael is such a friendly host and we would definitely come back.
We are so grateful we were able to check in late. This was a very welcoming and interesting home. I would definitely stay here again if given the opportunity

This place was awesome! It is removed from other houses in the neighborhood so it was very peaceful, but it was an easy drive to the Ocean View grocery store, beaches, South Point, and ~an hour to the national park. The bed was super comfy and the studio was equipped with all the pots, pans, mugs, and silverware we needed for cooking. The shower and bathroom are both outside the room and the shower is outside, but it was easy to use and nice to shower under the stars! Carol Ann and Michael were both great communicators and provided everything we needed. Would highly recommend!

we totally enjoyed our night at carol ann's place. its very quiet up there. the place is just lovely. showers and toilets outside but everything super clean. can highly recommend this place. it is definitely not a place were you usually stay and totally worth it.

Es waren sehr schöne Tage bei Carol Ann und Michael. Die Unterkunft ist super! Sehr ruhig gelegen und ein super Ausgangspunkt für Ausflüge. Michael war sehr hilfsbereit und hatte immer sehr gute Insidertips!

We had such a wonderful time here. Michael struck the perfect balance between hosting us and respecting our privacy. He gave us great recommendations on where to go and what to do, and it was so quiet and secluded. Kind of like camping but with the comforts of a shower, bathroom, bed, and kitchen. We would recommend this place to anyone.
This listing will not disappoint for your South Hawaii adventures. The hosts are amazing. The studio has everything you'd need :). And the fresh eggs were amazing :).

Wonderful place uphill. Private studio, exterior shower (brilliant idea, morning shower under the sun: a-we-so-me).

Outstanding hosts, i even got welcome cookies. So great. I would definitely come back.

Carol Ann und Michael sind wundervolle Menschen! Wir haben uns sehr wohl gefühlt. Alles ist mit viel Liebe gemacht und der Kühlschrank war voll mit leckeren Sachen für uns!!! Die Farm liegt zwar sehr abseits, aber dafür hat man einen wundervollen Blick aufs Meer und kann abends die Ruhe und die Sterne geniessen! Mahalo!

Le logement a tout ce dont vous avez besoin pour passer un séjour d'aventures ! C'est ce que nous recherchions au calme et dans la nature! Nous avons été très bien accueilli par les propriétaires. Nous avons apprécié les oeufs, les cookies fait maison, délicieux! Le logement est proche du parc des volcans.

Such an atypic place! Carol Ann and Micheal have a such a beautiful space! A wonderful cabin above the cloud. You'll find everything you need there. We wish we spent more time there!
We recommend

Great, quiet place to stay. A little far from the airports and nearby towns. If you are looking for solitude this is the place for you! Michael and Carol have a passion for Hawaii that is very admirable and infectious. Make sure to make time to walk around with Michael so he can tell you some of the Island stories!
Unexpected gem at ~4000 ft ( 1,200 meters ) elevation. Wonderful hosts, great local tips for sightseeing and relaxation.  Loved every minute of staying in this home.

Carol Ann's studio is the perfect getaway if you are looking to get off the grid. She was an amazing host and provided us with everything we needed including eggs and coffee in the morning. Her gardens and decor surrounding the house are incredible!

Carol Ann and her husband was very nice, friendly and thoughtful. They made cookies and lilikoi butter! The place is good even if it is humid. It is quiet. Furthermore, the garden’s decoration is hilarious! Good job!

Don't let the"off the grid" setup scare you away. Nice clean space with all the amenities you might expect. Even had some English muffins a fresh eggs so we could make ourselves breakfast in the morning. Good location for visiting south point.

Carol Ann and Mike are great people! They were very kind and did everything to make us feel comfortable! Moreover they told us a lot of things about Hawaiian culture and about places to visit. The place itself is very beautiful- every morning you can watch different sunrises or even take a sunrise shower. The bed is very comfortable. We really appreciated Carol Ann stocked our fridge with some basics to eat since we arrived late in the evening and that Mike helped us to inflate our tires when they were flat. Thanks for everything!

A beautiful place to be at 3000 ft. with a view over lava flows and the sea below. Don't miss the spectacular sunset from the lanai: quite a sight the setting sun glowing like Halema‘Uma‘U Crater. And in the morning enjoy breakfast on the same lanei. Fresh farm eggs, home made muffins and jam are in the fridge.
We liked the place!

Communication with Carol Ann and Mike was easy and they offered great local insight. Location was lovely (be sure to make sunset), however a bit remote depending on your schedule. The unit was clean and well stocked, and the shower a bit tricky. A quiet location - do your research for restaurants in advance or bring food with you from bigger centers.
On a passé un bon séjour au calme loin de tout. Nous avons été très bien accueillis et nourris. Carol Anne nous a préparé des bons petits biscuits et donné des oeufs du poulailler.

Carol and Micheal are really great hosts. We had been well greeting by the day we reached.  We heard many knowledge about big island and their stories. They prepared "everything" you need in the room. It was wonderful experience to stay at their home and they have such an amazing ocean view of sunset! There are many interesting decorations surrounding their house. Highly recommended to stay here.
Everything is great, lovely hosts, a nice room and a wonderful view.

Amazing farm using sustainable energy with love to details. We had our own apartment in nature and enjoyed the breakfast outside on the sunny terrace with a wonderful view. Both hosts are very welcoming and provided us with a bunch of helpful tips. We would definitely go there again!

Carol Ann's studio was very tidy and warm and she was very responsive throughout the entire process. We enjoyed the view from the studio and had a great night of sleep. We will recommend this place to travelers coming this way and would come back if we are on the island again.

Very simple to get to this location from anywhere on the island. It’s close to some of the best sights In Hawaii. 

The hosts are the most thoughtful people ever. We enjoyed our stay in this clean and super cozy cabin that has all the amenities you need to have a perfect Airbnb experience.

Thank you for the fresh eggs and the sample jar of your homemade Lilikoi butter spread!

Great place to stay. A bit out of the way of being close to sights, but worked out well for us as we were on our way to the east side of the island! The studio is wonderful! It was a nice surprise that there was some food provided in the kitchen and we cooked a nice dinner after arriving late! Really enjoyed the outdoor space and great night sky! Would definitely stay again!

A great host, a stunning location and a beautiful vacation house. My husband and I felt one with the nature. Truly a paradise in the paradise of Pacific. Carol Ann and Michael gave us great local tips. A must stay place in Ocean view.

Nous avons adorer notre séjour chez Carol Ann et Michael. La cabine est super, avec tout le nécessaire pour se faire des bons repas. Les hôtes étaient toujours souriants et prêts à nous conseiller sur les endroits à visiter. Nous recommandons cet endroit fortement.
Cette endroit est magnifique loin de la ville elle permets le soir de voir le plus beau ciel étoilé. Très intime propre et pratique j'ai adoré l'endroit
Tip top

One of the best Airbnb's for so many reasons: suite was exactly as described complete with comfy bed and pantry staples, very helpful hosts who responded quickly to all questions, beautiful view of gardens in the day and sunset in the evenings, in a peaceful and relaxing location. The local knowledge that Mr. Mike provided was so helpful for the rest of our trip (ie. we found the 'secret' beach on the north-west coast!). Two welcoming people with a gorgeous property to share.....what's not to love?!

It was a real surprise to find Carol Ann's comfy studio. I went to HOVE for business purposes and so it was wonderful to be able to find such a nice place to stay right in HOVE. I'd highly recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in the HOVE area for a few days or for a quiet retreat to get away from it all.

Hi Carol Ann,

Thanks for the lovely stay in your home. It met all our expectation and needs and we really enjoyed our time there. And wish we could return more than just once a year. We really appreciated the wonderful eggs. Thanks again, Robert and Nancy
Enjoyed seeing Ocean View from this angle. Michael and Carol Ann were great and a wealth of local information. Thanks for a great stay

Carol Ann and Michael’s place is absolutely beautiful! It’s really cool what they’ve been able to do while off the grid. They were both very nice and helpful. I would definitely recommend their place!

Carol Ann greeted me and Michael showed me around the place, both were very friendly and nice.
The room was very nice with huge windows, and if it had been a clear sky, it probably would have been amazing for stargazing. 
The shower is outside and the toilet is in an outhouse, so that might not be everyones cup of tea.. but you do have your private little courtyard to access these facilities.
It is quite a bit drive up, through the rocky lava-landscape - which is quite the experience in it self, it felt like quite the alien landscape to me...
The drive is quite rocky, and you need to be careful with your rental car.
A cozy studio with an amazing view. Hosts were very friendly and made us feel welcome. The fresh eggs and coffee were delicious. Would love to stay here again. Thank you!
I cannot recommend Carol Ann's B&B enough. It was an amazing experience.
Endroit discret et paisible, l’aménagement est prévu pour votre confort
This place is just perfect. Very quiet, comfortable and private. I would have definitely stayed longer! You will not be disappointed.
Awesome and unique place out in the oceanview area of Big Island. Worth going to for the scenery alone, but with the added bonus of great hospitality.
This place is great! Totally off the beaten path (and grid) and our experience was consistent with all of the other positive reviews. Very thoughtful hosts with local knowledge...and super friendly!

We stayed in 5 different Airbnb while visiting the big island. Carol Anne’s place was my favorite! Don’t let the outdoor shower deter you because it was great and there is plenty of privacy. The air is cool and refreshing at night. The place is clean and the big windows are awesome. I couldn’t say enough good things about our stay there.
The place was so fun. Loved the outdoor shower and thanks for the surprise bottle of bubbly for our honeymoon
Great place to stay!
Nice, cosy cabin with a stocked fridge and everything you need. Welcoming host.

Thoughtful touches were apparent and appreciated. We felt like we were staying in a family members home and loved being away from the hustle and bustle of a big city. You must step out in the wee hours of the night to take a look at the stars - absolutely spectacular! The eggs, English muffins, jam & coffee were and extra special touch and absolutely delicious!

We really loved our stay in the cabin! It was very cozy, comfortable and peaceful - surrounded by nature all round. Carol Ann and Mike also generously stocked up the fridge with fresh eggs, bagels, muffins, and provided local coffee for a great start to the day! A short but wonderful stay.

Sweet little room. The view would have been spectacular if not for the vog.  Like going to a cabin that is owned by a favourate(Canadian spelling) aunt and uncle. Everything was there that was needed, and they didn't bother you if your up to hanky panky.  BTW, my 30th anniversary. Flush toilet,  just steps outside. This was the first time my wife showered outside, there are curtains.

Carol Ann and Michael provided us a wonderful place to stay. The room is beautifully decorated and definitely feels like home. They are both super nice and provided us a lot of local tips. Highly recommend!!
Lovely home & great location. Carol Ann was so helpful and responsive, I recommend her place!

Carol and his friend were very kind and helpful. their place is amazing overall quiet at night. She gave us organic eggs with some biscuits for breakfast and extra free food as well. the House had everything needed and super clean.

My friend and I had a great time staying here. We were adventuring every day all day and it was nice to come back to this tucked away place. Loved the outdoor shower and charm of the property in general. It’s a bit far back from the main road but for us it was a perfect retreat. Would definitely stay here again :)

The place was wonderful, with thoughtful touches throughout. I unfortunately wasn't able to meet Carol Ann as I had to get in and out of the place at late and early hours, but the communication was great, and I knew all I needed to to reach the property. It's a great, cozy, and private place that I would certainly recommend for future guests!

Un rifugio bellissimo, lontanto da tutti, con una vista mozzafiato e una casetta per lo più autosostenibile. Carol Ann ha molte attenzioni per i suoi ospiti, consigliatissimo per un esperienza giovane e dinamica

WHAT A VIEW! Such a homey and sweet place to stay. I love the little touches put in place here. Unfortunately only stayed for a night due to my schedule, but if you have an opportunity-definitely go for more than a day to enjoy what’s around!
